intro: Combretum ghasalense, commonly known as the Ghasal bush, is a deciduous shrub or small tree native to parts of East Africa. It belongs to the family Lythraceae and is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant produces capsules as fruits, which contain numerous tiny seeds. It is often found in dry, open habitats and is adapted to seasonal rainfall patterns.
